meanings.definition: A person who captures or detains another
meanings.sent1: The captors led the prisoner away in handcuffs.
meanings.sent2: The captors demanded a ransom for the release of the hostage.
meanings.sent3: The captors played a game of hide-and-seek with their friends.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle of life, our fears can become our captors.
meanings.sent5: The captors' faces were etched with determination as they pursued their target.

meanings.definition: The act of capturing or detaining someone
meanings.sent1: The captors' capture of the criminal was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The captors' capture of the spy revealed valuable information.
meanings.sent3: The captors' capture of the flag ended the game in victory.
meanings.sent4: The captors' capture of the moment in a photograph preserved the memory forever.
meanings.sent5: The captors' capture of the spotlight made them famous overnight.
